content.title: Arm Vein Mapping
content.description: Pre-operative duplex ultrasound mapping of upper extremity veins as alternative conduit when lower extremity veins are inadequate.
key_concepts: Cephalic vein course from wrist to deltopectoral groove
Basilic vein from elbow to axilla
Diameter requirements (minimum 2.5mm for coronary, 3mm for peripheral)
Previous IV access and scarring evaluation
content.clinical_application: Secondary conduit option when leg veins unavailable. Often requires splicing due to shorter usable segments. Basilic vein preferred for quality; cephalic for length.
advantages: Arm preservation less critical than leg
Often unused in patients with previous leg procedures
Better size match for tibial anastomoses

primary_sources: Arm Vein Conduit for Infrainguinal Bypass literature
